column4: I have an HP dv2500 with Intel Wireless WifiLink 4965 AGN wireless card, somehow the wireless interface is not showing up after I have restarted the system, the wireless modules are loaded as indicated by lsmod, they are "iwl4965"
i have tried doing modeprobe -r iwl4965 and then doing modeprobe iwl4965 again
crackhead100, do you know if you card associates with an access point? you can check this using iwconfig
it's associated with the right access point..
or seems to be..
is that access point under your control? Do you know it is running DHCP ?
it's a d-link wireless router, very simple, and yes, i think it uses dhcp.. dont know why it wouldnt.. it's connected fine before to othe rlaptops runnign windows and whatever else..
which wireless security mode does the wireless router use?
see above...
see what above?
it's a dlink wireless router, veyr simple.. other comps running windows and ubuntu have connected fine to it, using dhcp..
oh I mean, which security mode does the wireless router use? WPA, WEP etc?
it's using wpa 40 bit or something right now.. 0000000000.. a form of that
you get that?
i can't change the encryption or anyting..
others are using it set as is..
how have you specified the security key using ubuntu?

well, i was using wireless assistant.. but it doesn't work.. i try iwconfig and it sets fine.. but then i try to get a lease from the router and get a connection, and it doesnt.. just 255.255.255.255 during dhcpdiscover or whatever.. and then no leases.. sleeping..
nixbox:
how have you specified the security key using ubuntu?
what do you mean? i set it in the iwconfig and then also i tried it in the wirelessassistant program..
hello? what do you mean??
